answers.answer: I have the same but no panic attacks , it all to do with eating I believe ..
I have just checked something out and I have all the symptoms of Reactive Hypoglycemia , apparently cut out the sugar, well thats what I am going to do, I will let you know how I feel ..
There are many causes for glucose to rise, high anxiety is one of them. Try to locate and attend a diabetes education class. Check with your local hospital as they routinely offer free seminars.

question: A year ago I had normal blood sugar levels. Recently I have been suffering from anxiety attacks and light headedness. Done a fasting blood sugar test and it seems I have high blood sugar levels. Than this be the result of my anxiety attacksThis discussion is related to/posts/show/384507.
title: raised  blood sugar levels
